STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 7, 2022
Jacqueline Luzi
Adoption and Foster Care Specialists, Inc.
Suite 210
350 N. Court
Lapeer, MI 48446
RE: License #: CB440295542
Adoption and Foster Care Specialists, Inc.
Suite 210
350 N. Court
Lapeer, MI 48446
Dear Ms. Luzi:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 1/20/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP did not achieve compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the six current foster home files reviewed indicated the foster parent was not
given an application for the renewal of the license at least 60 days before the
expiration date of the license. In this file the expiration date of the license was
10/22/21 and the application was sent 09/14/21.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(c) Race,
Five of the six current foster home files reviewed contained annual evaluations that
did not identify the race/ethnicity of appropriate placements in the recommendations
of the report as required by this rule. The other required characteristics were
identified.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of the
following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the report.
One of the three special evaluations reviewed included the last name of a child
placed in the home as a part of the completed special evaluation report. The intake
date for this evaluation was 06/14/21.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
4

(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days of its
completion.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation to
indicate the foster parents were given a copy of the special evaluation report upon
its completion as required by this rule. Typically, the agency has a cover letter that
is sent to document this requirement, but the letter could not be located at the time
of this review. REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED 11/19/2020 Renewal, CAP
Approved 11/25/2020
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she has a
right to have his or her written response included as an
attachment to the report required by subrule (5) of this rule.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation to
indicate the foster parents were informed in writing that they have a right to include a
written response included as an addendum to the report as required by this rule.
These were the same two as identified in noncompliance with 327(6)(a). REPEAT
VIOLATION ESTABLISHED 11/19/2020 Renewal, CAP Approved 11/25/2020
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services worker
that has children placed in the home.
Three of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social service worker with children in the home was given a copy of the completed
special evaluation report as required by this rule.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the eight foster child records reviewed contained an updated service plan
that was completed outside the timeline established. In this file the service plan time
period ended 01/10/22 and it was completed 01/12/22. REPEAT VIOLATION
ESTABLISHED 11/19/2020 Renewal, CAP Approved 11/25/2020
5

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
 All signed documents should include dates of signature within 30 days of the
document completion date.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period, which was for the renewal evaluation
completed 11/19/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that
evaluation were 312(2)(c), 327(6)(a)(b), and 418(2)(b). The corrective action plan
for these noncompliance was approved 11/25/2020. The areas identified as repeat
noncompliance as a part of this interim review were 327(6)(a)(b), and 418(2)(b).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the corrective action plan for
the renewal evaluation completed 11/19/2020. The effectiveness of the corrective
action plan was assessed/reviewed with additional expectations for establishing and
maintaining compliance being developed.
Interviews
Child welfare staff were included in entrance and exit conferences with no areas of
concern noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
6

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
01/27/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 2, 2022
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
